nodes.documentation:
@title RefundableCrowdsale
@dev Extension of Crowdsale contract that adds a funding goal, and
the possibility of users getting a refund if goal is not met.
WARNING: note that if you allow tokens to be traded before the goal 
is met, then an attack is possible in which the attacker purchases 
tokens from the crowdsale and when they sees that the goal is 
unlikely to be met, they sell their tokens (possibly at a discount).
The attacker will be refunded when the crowdsale is finalized, and
the users that purchased from them will be left with worthless 
tokens. There are many possible ways to avoid this, like making the
the crowdsale inherit from PostDeliveryCrowdsale, or imposing 
restrictions on token trading until the crowdsale is finalized.
This is being discussed in 
https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-solidity/issues/877
This contract will be updated when we agree on a general solution
for this problem.
nodes.name: RefundableCrowdsale

nodes.documentation:
@dev Constructor, creates RefundEscrow.
@param goal Funding goal
@return minimum amount of funds to be raised in wei.
nodes.name: goal

nodes.documentation:
@dev Investors can claim refunds here if crowdsale is unsuccessful
@param beneficiary Whose refund will be claimed.
nodes.name: claimRefund

nodes.documentation:
@dev Checks whether funding goal was reached.
@return Whether funding goal was reached
nodes.name: goalReached

nodes.documentation: @dev escrow finalization task, called when finalize() is called
nodes.name: _finalization

nodes.documentation: @dev Overrides Crowdsale fund forwarding, sending funds to escrow.
nodes.name: _forwardFunds

nodes.name: _forwardFunds

buyTokens(address).details: low level token purchase ***DO NOT OVERRIDE*** This function has a non-reentrancy guard, so it shouldn't be called by another `nonReentrant` function.

claimRefund(address).details: Investors can claim refunds here if crowdsale is unsuccessful

finalize().details: Must be called after crowdsale ends, to do some extra finalization work. Calls the contract's finalization function.

finalized().return: true if the crowdsale is finalized, false otherwise.

goal().return: minimum amount of funds to be raised in wei.

goalReached().details: Checks whether funding goal was reached.

hasClosed().details: Checks whether the period in which the crowdsale is open has already elapsed.

isOpen().return: true if the crowdsale is open, false otherwise.

rate().return: the number of token units a buyer gets per wei.

wallet().return: the address where funds are collected.
